wikipedia_page.main: Maclean Rogers (13 July 1899 – 4 January 1962) was a British film director and screenwriter.

The novel has twice been adapted as a film, with the 1933 version Summer Lightning directed by Maclean Rogers.Taves (2006), p. 161. A 1938 Swedish adaptation, under the title Thunder and Lightning, was directed by Anders Henrikson and starred Olof Winnerstrand and his wife Frida Winnerstrand.Taves (2006), p. 168.
*Shadowed Eyes, directed by Maclean Rogers (1940)
*Shadowed Eyes (dir. Maclean Rogers, 1940)
|Maclean Rogers

Just Joe is a 1960 British comedy film directed by Maclean Rogers, and starring Leslie Randall, Joan Reynolds, Michael Shepley, and Anna May Wong. The unassuming Joe (Leslie Randall) discovers his heroic side when he becomes involved with spies chasing the secret formula of a new detergent.
Category:Films directed by Maclean Rogers
Two Maclean Rogers films were made from Toff adventures in 1952: Salute the Toff and Hammer the Toff. The Toff was played by John Bentley in both films.

The production was shot over a two-week shooting schedule. Milligan, who wrote most of the radio scripts for the Goons, had no role creating in the film's screenplay. Bentine would later tell an interviewer that the film's lack of financing required director Maclean Rogers to only permit one take per scene. Rogers, however, incorporated two dance numbers into the film featuring showgirls as female soldiers practising for a talent show.Film Threat review
Category:Films directed by Maclean Rogers
* A Clean Sweep (Maclean Rogers) (1958)

Paid in Error is a 1938 British comedy film directed by Maclean Rogers and featuring George Carney, Lillian Christine and Tom Helmore. The screenplay concerns a man who is mistakenly given a large sum of money at the bank.
Category:Films directed by Maclean Rogers
Heaven is Round the Corner is a 1944 British musical film directed by Maclean Rogers with Will Fyffe, Leni Lynn, Leslie Perrins, and Austin Trevor.Heaven Is Round the Corner (1944) - IMDb
Twice Branded is a 1936 British drama film directed by Maclean Rogers and starring James Mason, Robert Rendel and Lucille Lisle. It was made at Walton Studios as a quota quickie.Wood p.88
Category:Films directed by Maclean Rogers

His Lordship Regrets is a 1938 British comedy film directed by Maclean Rogers and starring Claude Hulbert, Winifred Shotter, Gina Malo and Aubrey Mallalieu. Impoverished Lord Cavender pursues wealthy Mabel van Morgan only to discover himself in love with the apparently penniless Mary.
Category:Films directed by Maclean Rogers

His Lordship Goes to Press is a 1938 British comedy film directed by Maclean Rogers and starring June Clyde, Hugh Williams, Louise Hampton and Leslie Perrins. The film follows an American reporter who goes to work on a farm for an assignment, where a case of mistaken identity ensues.
Category:Films directed by Maclean Rogers

Father Steps Out is a 1937 British comedy film directed by Maclean Rogers and starring George Carney, Dinah Sheridan, Bruce Seton and Peter Gawthorne. Wealthy cheese manufacturer Joe Hardcastle (George Carney) falls prey to a gang of con men, but is rescued in the nick of time by his chauffeur (Bruce Seton).
Category:Films directed by Maclean Rogers
Easy Riches is a 1938 British comedy film directed by Maclean Rogers and starring George Carney, Gus McNaughton, Marjorie Taylor and Tom Helmore.
Category:Films directed by Maclean Rogers

Summer Lightning is a 1933 British comedy film directed by Maclean Rogers and starring Ralph Lynn, Winifred Shotter, Chili Bouchier and Horace Hodges. It is based on the 1929 novel Summer Lightning by P.G. Wodehouse.
Category:Films directed by Maclean Rogers
